description: Non-Material Amendment to planning permission reference 73955/APP/2022/2613, dated 20-03-2023 to allow amendments to the wording of conditions 12, 36 and 38 to allow for phased discharge.
decision_conditions: Condition 12 of planning permission 73955/APP/2022/2613 is amended to:

Prior to the occupation of each phase of the development as defined within drawing numbers: 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-01-DR-A-010102 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-01-DR-A-010103 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-02-DR-A-010104 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-03-DR-A-010105 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-RF-DR-A-010112 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-00-DR-A-010101 Rev P01; a Verification Report demonstrating that the approved drainage/SuDS measures have been fully implemented for that phase shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.
- As built drawings of the sustainable drainage systems including level information (if appropriate)
- Photographs of the completed sustainable drainage systems throughout the construction process
- Any relevant certificates from manufacturers/suppliers of any drainage features.
- Confirmation statement of the above signed by a chartered engineer.
Condition 36 of planning permission 73955/APP/2022/2613 is amended to:

(i) Construction (with the exception of demolition and site preparation works) shall not commence until a finalised scheme to deal with contamination has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority (LPA) in accordance with the Supplementary Planning Guidance Document on Land Contamination, and approved by the LPA. All works which form part of the remediation scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is occupied or brought into use unless the Local Planning Authority dispenses with any such requirement specifically and in writing. The scheme shall include all of the following measures unless the LPA dispenses with any such requirement specifically and in writing:

(a) A written method statement providing details of a definitive and detailed remediation scheme and how the completion of the remedial works will be verified shall be agreed in writing with the LPA prior to commencement, along with
Condition 38 of planning permission 73955/APP/2022/2613 is amended to:

Before occupation of each phase of the development, as defined within drawing numbers: 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-01-DR-A-010102 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-01-DR-A-010103 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-02-DR-A-010104 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-03-DR-A-010105 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-RF-DR-A-010112 Rev P01; 1140CTC-FRA-ZZ-00-DR-A-010101 Rev P01 that phase of the buildings and car park shall achieve written confirmation of 'secured by design' accreditation from Hillingdon Metropolitan Police Crime Prevention Design Advisor (CPDA) on behalf of the Association of Chief Police Officers (ACPO).

In pursuance of the Council's duty under section 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 to consider crime and disorder implications in excising its planning functions; to promote the well being of the area in pursuance of the Council's powers under section 2 of the Local Government Act 2000 to ensure the development provides a safe and secure enviro

Notwithstanding the non-material amendments hereby approved, other than Conditions 12, 36 and 38 which are superseded by the above conditions, all other conditions relating to planning permission reference 73955/APP/2022/2613 dated 20-03-23, must be discharged/adhered to as per that permission.
